definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Three little kittens, started to yawn.
sentences.chinese: 三个小猫猫，开始打呵欠。

sentences.english: An Indian boy yawns as he washes plates at a roadside resturant.
sentences.chinese: 一个印度男孩在路旁的餐厅洗盘子时打呵欠。

sentences.english: Yawn publicly with an open mouth, indicating boredom.
sentences.chinese: 在公共场所，张大嘴巴连连打呵欠，显示你极度厌倦。

sentences.english: Seeing the yawns of the children, she sent them to bed.
sentences.chinese: 看到孩子们在打呵欠，她就打发他们去睡觉了。
她在他的课上不停地打呵欠。

sentences.english: He plops behind the desk, yawns and rubs his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他扑通一声跌坐在办公桌前，又打呵欠又擦眼睛的。

sentences.english: The key yawn instigator appears to be brain temperature.
sentences.chinese: 打呵欠最关键的诱因就是大脑的温度。

sentences.english: A person yawns and you believe that person is bored with your message.
sentences.chinese: 一个人打呵欠，你会认为那个人对你的信息厌烦。

sentences.english: I felt so sleepy I couldn't stop yawning.
sentences.chinese: 我感到很困，止不住地打呵欠。

sentences.english: Yawning frequency changes over the life span.
sentences.chinese: 打呵欠的频率随着人生阶段的变化而不断改变。

sentences.english: Yawning is a behavior that begins in the first stages of life.
sentences.chinese: 打呵欠是生命早期就存在的行为。

sentences.english: At the dawn on the lawn the yawning drowned man begin to frown.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时在草坪上，打呵欠的溺水者开端皱眉头。

sentences.english: She kept yawning as a hint that she was tired.
sentences.chinese: 她不断打呵欠，暗示她累了。

sentences.english: He yawned his jaws out of joint.
sentences.chinese: 他打呵欠打得下巴关节脱了臼。

sentences.english: His long boring story made me yawn.
sentences.chinese: 他的冗长的故事听得我直打呵欠。

definition: to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to relax with one's eyes closed
